result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary A Garcia

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:45 AM cases 21CF754, 22CF334, 22CF1124 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Mary A Garcia appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Mary A Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits in 22CF1124. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/31/22 AT 1:30 PM. Return to court: 11/10/22 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:33 AM Cases called: 22CF754 & 22CF334. Defendant Mary A Garcia in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Mary A Garcia. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives reading of Information in 22CF334 and enters Not Guilty pleas. This is a Judge Barna case. 

The parties are close to a resolution and ask that both cases come back into Br. 4 on 10/19/22 at 9:15am.
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on August 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: granting request to appear remotely (Officer MIchael Madrid)

(Cases called at 2:00 PM - 21CF754 and 22CF334)
Defendant Mary Garcia appears with Attorney Francis Rivard.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing held as to 22CF334.  State calls Officer Michael Madrid to the stand - sworn and testifies.  Court takes judicial notice of the bond set in 21CF754.  Cross-examination by Defense.  Officer Madrid steps down.  State presents argument.  Court finds that a felony was committed by the Defendant (violated terms of her bond - no acts or threats of violence).  Cases referred to Branch 4 for further scheduling.
